State Law reference- Power of city to regulate the construction of buildings, RSMo 79.450(3); Underground Facility Safety and Damage Prevention Act, RSMo 319.010 et seq.; inadequate and deficient housing, RSMo 441.500 et seq.; construction materials standards, RSMo 701.010 et seq. 

ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL 

Sec. 7-1. - Structure construction material. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person to construct or erect any building or structure having the exterior walls constructed of any material other than brick or stone masonry or other material approved by the BOCA Code enforced in the city. 
(b)  The provisions of this section shall not apply in the erection or construction of the following: 
(1)  Temporary one-story frame building for use by a builder, contractor or developer. 
(2)  Standard fences. 
(3)  Children's playhouses which shall not exceed 150 square feet in area nor eight feet in height. 
(4)  Any one-story frame accessory structure or building, such as unattached garages or storage buildings, which shall not exceed 800 square feet in area. 
(Code 1973, § 6-1; Ord. No. 2431, § 1, 2-27-95) 
Sec. 7-2. - Exterior walls to be constructed of brick or masonry. 
(a)  No person shall erect any building or any addition to any building heretofore erected in any of the commercial, service and industrial districts of the city, as these districts are presently established by the city's zoning ordinance or may in the future be established by any amendment thereto, having exterior walls constructed of any material other than brick or stone masonry or other material acceptable to the building commissioner. 
(b)  All cooling towers and mechanical equipment installed in conjunction with any building or installed upon any building in any commercial, service or industrial district shall be enclosed on all sides by walls extending to the height of the highest projection of such equipment and constructed of brick or stone masonry or other material acceptable to the building commissioner. 
(Code 1973, § 6-2) 
Cross reference- Zoning, app. A. 
Secs. 7-3-7-20. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE II. - BUILDING COMMISSIONER[2] 

Footnotes: 
--- (2) --- 
Cross reference- Administration, ch. 2; housing, ch. 13; zoning, app. A. 

Sec. 7-21. - Office established. 
    The office of building commissioner is hereby established for the city. 
(Code 1973, § 6-16) 
Sec. 7-22. - Powers and duties. 
    The building commissioner shall: 
(1)  Issue building permits for all construction within the city limits. 
(2)  Enforce the building code, zoning ordinance and housing code of the city and any regulations promulgated thereunder. 
(3)  Enforce the ordinances of the city pertaining to the erection, construction, use and location of buildings and structures of all types. 
(4)  Perform all inspections for the enforcement of the building code, housing code, zoning ordinance or other ordinances of the city relating to the erection, construction, maintenance or use of buildings, structures and premises. 
(5)  Perform such other duties as directed by the mayor or board of aldermen. 
(Code 1973, § 6-18) 
Sec. 7-23. - Right to enter buildings in emergencies. 
    In emergency situations involving immediate danger to health or safety, the building commissioner shall have the right of entry for the purpose of inspecting any and all buildings and premises as to their compliance with the terms and provisions of the building code, housing code, zoning ordinance or any other ordinance of the city relating to the erection, construction, maintenance or use of buildings, structures or premises. The building commissioner shall carry the proper credentials of his office at all times and shall exhibit these to any persons requesting the same whenever any inspections are being made; and prior to the right of asking entry to any building or onto any premises, such credentials shall be exhibited and the building commissioner shall state to any such persons there that the purpose of any such inspection is to determine their compliance with the building code, housing code, zoning ordinance or any other ordinance of the city relating to the erection, use or maintenance of structures, buildings or premises. 
(Code 1973, § 6-19) 
Sec. 7-24. - Unlawful to deny entry. 
    No person shall deny the building commissioner the right of entry to a building, structure or premises under the provisions of section 7-23 for the purpose of performing an inspection in connection with the enforcement of the building code, housing code, zoning ordinance and any other ordinance of the city concerned with the erection, use or maintenance of buildings, structures or premises in the city. 
(Code 1973, § 6-20) 
Sec. 7-25. - Interfering with prohibited. 
    It shall be unlawful for any person to interfere with the building commissioner in the performance of his official duties. 
(Code 1973, § 6-21) 
Secs. 7-26-7-40. - Reserved.

Note A. Electrical outlets. Each and every point on the electrical system where power or light is derived for any purpose whatsoever. In computing outlets for flourescent fixtures, each fixture shall be counted as an electrical outlet. 
Note B. Service equipment. Each and every point on the electrical system where power is derived from the public utility systems or a private generating plant. 
Note C. Switch boards and panel boards. Each and every point on the electrical system where switches or protective devices are mounted in an individual panel or single framework. 
Note D. Transformers. Each and every point on the electrical system where the primary voltage is either increased or decreased. 
Note E. X-rays. Every point on the electrical system where an individual x-ray device or machine is served. 
Note F. Residential rewire. Inspection of rewiring, rehabilitation, additions and alterations to existing electrical wiring and equipment installation to residential occupancies of the R-2 and R-3 use groups. 
Note G. Reinspections-disconnected service. Reinspection of buildings on which service wires have been removed, or in commercial installations when a change in tenancy has taken place or installations of the "R" use group which may not have been in use for a period of six months or more. This does not apply to cases of discontinuance of service pending payment of delinquent bills. 
Note H. Reinspections-Old installations. Inspections of old installations of electrical work, made upon request of the owner, and issuance of certificates thereon. 
(Ord. No. 09-07, § 2, 2-23-09; Ord. No. 11-41, § 1, 9-26-11; Ord. No. 11-59, § 2, 11-28-11; Ord. No. 12-20, § 1, 4-9-12)
